name: Hotel La Fenice et des Artistes

reviews.text: Place is like a maze -really hard to follow an A-Z, but was very beautiful with the Gondolas all around.
reviews.title: Beautiful Canals

reviews.text: Gondola rides about 80 euros a boat-but if you share with 3 or 4 its a better deal -definitely worth a ride.
reviews.title: GREAT value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Boats that take you around the canal are really frequent and a lovely way to see the city
reviews.title: Atrocious Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friendly atmosphere with often musicians playing in the squares and a lively time at night.
reviews.title: MIXED FEELINGS

reviews.text: I had a great time at this hotel, good value for money....the staff was extremely helpful from the time I checked in till checkout.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, nice location but overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though not modern and sparkly, this hotel was a perfect fit for our nights in Venice. We actually did not spend much time in the room because of exploring the city every day. Our room was overlooking the courtyard. We had a lot of space. It was very clean. The location was central. The breakfast was European with cheeses, meats and breads. Fine for us. What made this place excellent was the staff. Given umbrellas to borrow on a rainy day, good dining recommendations, questions always answered with a smile, and the desk attendant walked us to our water taxi on our check out day. That was wonderful as we had been lost so many times. Old world feel and nice hospitality. Oops... Mosquitos when we were there. DO not leave your window open. You will be sorry. Thank you Hotel Fenice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room size is adequate but the little things are annoying. The sink doesn't drain properly, the paint is peeling from the ceiling, one light in the bathroom is dangling. The staff is very nice however. We've been in nicer hotels in Rome and Florence.
reviews.title: A bit worn and shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here two nights; a friend recommended this hotel to us. It was in a good location - close to everything, but in a quiet square so there wasn't much street noise most of the time. We had very loud upstairs neighbors our second night, but a pair of earplugs solved that problem for me!
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite charming - a good size, a lot of storage room, etc. Our room had an unusual smell - we think it was the comforter, as the smell was gone after housekeeping came the second day. The bathroom was immaculate and a nice size. Our shower sprayer (the kind on a flexible hose that can be adjusted for height) did not stay in place and kept twisting around and sliding down, so I had to hold it up while I showered!
reviews.title: Fantastic location and excellent staff help make this a great hotel for a romantic getaway

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and spoke pretty good English. Breakfast was pretty sparse and was so busy on our second morning that we ended up eating in the lounge next to the breakfast room. We would have liked to have seen more food set out, but maybe this is typical of Venetian hotels.
reviews.title: Great quiet spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is a gem hidden away from the heavily populated areas but easily reached and within comfortable walking distance of St. Mark's Square. The staff was more than accommodating to the extent that one of the front desk persons( a gentleman) actually left his post to walk us to the restaurant he had suggested for dinner! It was delicious by the way! Staff made reservations for our water taxis and a night at the Opera in an old palace...what a treat. We stayed for four nights, left for a seven day cruise, then returned for one night before returning to the San Francisco area.Jada at the Front desk made us feel very welcome and taken care of. The porter carried our many(too many) suitcases to meet the water taxi twice with a smile on his face despite the heavy load and stayed with us until we had safely boarded and were on our way. I will return to Venice and I can't wait to return to La Fenice des Artistes...........a grateful guest
reviews.title: Wonderful staff,quaint,excellant location,lovely large room overlooking the canal

reviews.text: I have stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. If you plan to stay there please call them before to confirm that they have received your reservation with all the details. I have booked a room with a kingsize bed and Internet connection but on arrival I was allocated a room with two small beds and without Internet connection. The consierge was so kind to change my room to the one with kingsize bed but there were no rooms with Internet connection. They advertise this hotel as having free Internet connection in all rooms. The reality is that free internet means 15 min a day and only in the hotel lobby. They also advertise the hotel as providing buffet breakfast but this means only cold stuff. If you are after eggs you would have to pay extra. The highest score this hotel achieves is in cleansness and excellent staff manners.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a catch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked this hotel as a birthday present and when we read the reviews about it we almost cancelled but what a mistake that would have been. We spent 2 nights here and loved every minute of our stay. The hotel is in a quiet square next to the Opera House in Venice. It is in a perfect spot to escape the crowds. The rooms and public areas are covered in interesting art works and there is even an accompanying brochure which explains them all. We were given a large room at the front of the hotel over the square and bar below. The room was almost like a suite with a seperate sitting area. Yes some of the decoration and furniture is dated but that is part of the hotel's charm. The room was clean and bright and we loved going back to it after long days taking in the sights of Venice. After a show one night we opened the windows to hear opera singers singing in the bar below and it was wonderful. Staff were courteous,helpful and efficient. Absolutely no complaints and if we ever returned to Venice this is where we would want to stay. Please do not be put off by poor reviews about this hotel. If you want modern, functional and boring then this is not the hotel for you but if you want an interesting piece of venice history and quality service you will love it like we did.
reviews.title: Please please ignore the bad reviews about this hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great. Quick to get to san marco square and easy to find on arrival. The room was well sized and clean. The hotel is a bit old, old antique furniture with venetian lights. Bathroom was small but adequate. Hotel provided a continental breakfast, juice, cereal, croissants. Has a lovely little courtyard where you can relax at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Apparently, many hotels in Italy hurriedly added hair dryers and a tv to their rooms before the jubilee in order to go from 3 to 4 stars. This one looks like they did. For the money and stars, the rooms should be cleaner and less worn, amenities be better, breakfast be more ample and staff more friendly. The location is good, but Venice is so compact (and packed with hotels), that you could find something else as good. If you have the time and disposition, you could even walk around and find a place with a vacancy. Not worth the money.
reviews.title: Deserves only 3 stars.

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel in a good location: just a few minutes from all the major spots and easy to reach from the water bus stops. Our group had two single rooms and a twin room, each of which was well appointed, traditionally decorated (but NOT shabby) and clean. The twin room was on the top floor and with sloping ceilings and a very high window, so there was no view from the room - but then we didn't go to Venice to look out of a window! Views from the other rooms were lovely. One of the rooms didn't have a shower, but did have a bath. All in all the rooms were fine. Breakfast was also good: a buffet with bread, cheese, meat, fruit, cereal, yoghurts and as much coffee / tea / juice as you wanted. Do be careful of mosquitoes - we didn't leave our windows open, but still managed to play host and I have the scars to prove it!
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a very pleasant lounge and a lovely little courtyard.
reviews.title: Great location, beyond adequate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess the hotel might seem expensive for what it is - it isn't fabulously luxurious, but it's comfy, clean and friendly - and remember Venice IS expensive.
reviews.title: Good hotel well situated.
Do Not Stay At This Hotel
reviews.text: When arriving the easiest bus stop to reach the hotel from is San Angelo - just follow the instructions on the hotel website and you can't go wrong. This route includes just two bridges and is a much quieter route than approaching from San Marco - so it's easier to manage with suitcases. To reach San Angelo you will need the Alilaguna 'A' line from the airport: tickets can be bought in the airport for 13e each.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Useful websites: www.hellovenezia.com www.actv.it (these are both offical sites for the two bus companies)
reviews.title: Very good room, pleasant staff, good and charming location.

description: The hotel is located in the heart of Venice near the famous La Fenice theatre, and for more than a century has been a preferred venue for artists and intellectuals.
